instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont go to sleep.
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> If i put it to sleep the screen turns off but fan will keep on spinning and power consumption is the same as if it is still on. after about 10 seconds you can still wake it up but any longer it will never wake up again. Have to force shut down and reboot.
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.4v when trying to wake up. Any advice on what i can check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont go to sleep.
threads.message:
If backlight goes off when close the lid, the <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal acts correctly.
However, be sure it is steady 0V then.
Check <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> voltages after lid closed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont go to sleep.
threads.message: I finally got this one fixed <RESISTOR>R1441</RESISTOR> Pin 2 pad was corroded .
